news.title: New Zealand's Fletcher Building to sell construction arm to French builder
news.para: Fletcher Building of New Zealand has agreed to divest its construction division to the French multinational VINCI SA for NZ$315.6 million. This decision stems from recent earnings pressure attributed to dwindling demand and complications, including a legal dispute related to project delays.

news.title: India Accelerator–IREP partnership to invest ₹100 crore in managed workspaces across NCR
news.para: International Real Estate Partners and India Accelerator are launching a new managed office platform called IREPworkspaces. They plan to invest ₹100 crore over 18 months. The venture aims to create nearly nine lakh square feet of workspace across key areas in the National Capital Region.

news.title: Lucknow: Lottery for Anantnangar scheme on January 30
news.para: The Lucknow Development Authority's Anant Nagar housing scheme's plot lottery is scheduled for January 30-31 at Indira Gandhi Pratishthan. The third phase attracted 7,429 applicants for 637 plots across five size categories, with applications invited for plots in Akash Khand and Adarsh Khand.

news.title: Gurugram: 83 trees felled to make way for illegal buildings and road in Aravalis
news.para: The forest department has filed a report over violations in the Aravalis following TOI's discovery of a new road and buildings on protected forest land. A fresh inspection revealed 83 trees felled, with further tree felling noted on Thursday, leading to an increased surveillance. This comes amidst ongoing scrutiny of illegal construction in the region.

news.title: Now, Mumbai’s Lokhandwala Complex in redevelopment mode, to grow taller
news.para: Lokhandwala Complex, a 40-year-old Mumbai housing colony, is undergoing extensive redevelopment driven by necessity and the desire for larger homes. Original residents, now senior citizens, face rising costs and potential affordability issues with new, larger apartments and increased maintenance expenses.

news.title: Pune civic body earns ₹713 crore from property tax amnesty scheme, extends it
news.para: Pune Municipal Corporation has extended its property tax amnesty scheme until February 16, following a successful initial run that collected Rs 713 crore from defaulters. This initiative offers a 75% waiver on penalties, aiming to encourage more property owners to clear dues. The civic body is also finalizing its budget for 2026-27, expected by month's end.

news.title: Chandigarh deputy commissioner sets March deadline for digitisation of property records
news.para: Chandigarh's Deputy Commissioner has set a March deadline for the digitisation of property records, emphasizing zero tolerance for errors and strict quality checks. The project, which began last September, aims to improve transparency, efficiency, and ease of accessing public records by creating authenticated e-files.

news.title: YEIDA to launch residential plots near Noida International airport
news.para: The Yamuna Expressway Industrial Development Authority (YEIDA) is launching a new residential plot scheme near the upcoming Noida International Airport in January. Offering 973 plots in various sizes across Sectors 15C, 18, and 24A, the scheme reserves a portion for farmers and industrialists. Successful applicants will be chosen via a lucky draw after depositing 10% of the plot cost.

news.title: Which law applies in DLF phases 1 to 5? DTCP meets Gurugram residents on jurisdiction
news.para: A public hearing was held in Gurugram regarding the applicable law for DLF 1 to 5. The Department of Town and Country Planning stated that violations fall under the Haryana Development and Regulation of Urban Areas Act, 1975. This confirms the department's legal authority for enforcement actions.

news.title: Unchecked construction in Rajpur ravines despite Uttarakhand HC ban
news.para: Rajpur residents allege unchecked construction in natural ravines violates a high court order banning encroachment. They highlight the area's seismic vulnerability and the construction of high-rise buildings without adequate monitoring, despite concerns over Dehradun's environmental degradation. Authorities are accused of failing to halt construction in ecologically fragile zones.

news.title: Plans afoot for urban slums survey in 2027
news.para: India will conduct a nationwide survey on urban slums in 2027. This survey will gather detailed information on living conditions in these settlements. It will assess the number of slums and households, and access to basic facilities like electricity, drainage, and water.

news.title: GRAP-4 in action, so what? C&D waste lies in open, roads being dug in Gurugram
news.para: Despite GRAP Stage 4 curbs in NCR, Gurgaon streets are rife with dust due to ongoing construction, road excavation, and debris dumping. Residents report little visible enforcement as activities like road cutting and rubble piling continue openly, exacerbating air quality concerns and impacting daily life.

news.title: Recover ₹25 lakh from Gmada for defaulting on plot possession: Punjab RERA
news.para: Punjab Rera has ordered the Mohali deputy commissioner to recover over Rs 25 lakh from Gmada, deeming it a judgment debtor. Gmada failed to provide timely possession of a plot auctioned in IT City in 2016, despite Rera's directives. The authority will now proceed against Gmada's assets to enforce the recovery.

news.title: Delhi government plans to upskill 1.20 lakh registered construction workers
news.para: The Delhi government announces a progressive plan to upskill 120,000 workers in the construction sector over a span of three years. With an emphasis on trades such as masonry and carpentry, this training initiative not only aims to improve job prospects but also seeks to elevate the economic standing of these workers.

news.title: New home prices in China fall again in December 2025; annual decline steepest in five months
news.para: China's real estate sector is still navigating rocky waters, with new home prices dipping once more in December, following a similar trend from November. This ongoing decline hints at a potential protracted slump unless the government steps in with more robust measures.

news.title: Oberoi Realty's net profit grows marginally to ₹622.64 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Oberoi Realty has revealed its financial outcomes for the quarter ending December 31, 2025. The company experienced a modest rise in net consolidated profit, along with a growth in total income when compared to the prior year's figures.

news.title: Stable liquidity, office demand keep real estate sentiment firm in Q4 2025
news.para: Indian real estate sentiment stabilized in late 2025. Both current and future outlooks remain positive. Steady economic conditions, lower inflation, and stable funding support the market. Office leasing remains strong, driven by Global Capability Centres. Residential markets show clearer signs of stability. The sector enters 2026 on a steadier footing.

news.title: Aurum PropTech posts net profit of ₹2.71 crore in Q3 FY26
news.para: Aurum PropTech achieved a net profit of ₹2.71 crore in the quarter ending December 31, 2025. This marks a strong recovery from a loss in the same period last year. The company's total income grew by 77.35 percent.

news.title: L&T Realty acquires land parcel in Mumbai’s Lower Parel for ₹448.6 crore
news.para: L&T Realty Developers has acquired a prime land parcel in Mumbai's Lower Parel-Elphinstone Road area. The deal was valued at Rs 448.6 crore. A portion of the payment includes cash and an area-sharing arrangement. L&T Realty plans to develop a 28-office floor tower on the site.

news.title: GCCs account for 45% of office absorption in 2025: Report
news.para: In 2025, Global Capability Centres significantly transformed India's office landscape, driving 45% of all leasing activity. This surge led to a staggering 78.2 million square feet in total office absorption. Alongside this boom, new office supply hit unprecedented levels, with vacancy rates dropping notably across major cities.
